description: A family of ferns known for their leathery fronds and widespread distribution in tropical and subtropical regions.

ferns.name: Polypodium vulgare
ferns.description: A hardy fern with leathery, evergreen fronds that thrive in rocky and shaded areas.

ferns.name: Polypodium glycyrrhiza
ferns.description: Known for its sweet-tasting roots, this fern grows on moist, shaded rocks and tree trunks.

ferns.name: Pleopeltis polypodioides
ferns.description: A remarkable fern that can survive drought by drying up and reviving when moisture returns.

ferns.name: Polypodium hesperium
ferns.description: A small fern found in the western United States, typically in rocky habitats.

ferns.name: Polypodium scouleri
ferns.description: This fern has thick, leathery fronds and is commonly found along the Pacific coast.

description: A large family of ferns with robust and often leathery fronds, commonly found in woodlands.

ferns.name: Dryopteris filix-mas
ferns.description: A sturdy fern with pinnate fronds, commonly found in temperate forests.

ferns.name: Dryopteris marginalis
ferns.description: Known for its evergreen fronds, this fern thrives in rocky, shaded environments.

ferns.name: Dryopteris erythrosora
ferns.description: This fern features striking copper-red fronds that mature to green.

ferns.name: Dryopteris cristata
ferns.description: A fern with uniquely crested fronds, typically found in wetland areas.

ferns.name: Dryopteris affinis
ferns.description: A robust fern with yellowish fronds and a preference for moist, shaded habitats.

description: A family of ferns known for their delicate, often finely divided fronds, common in arid and tropical regions.

ferns.name: Adiantum capillus-veneris
ferns.description: A delicate fern with fan-shaped fronds and black stems, commonly found in humid environments.

ferns.name: Pteris cretica
ferns.description: A fern with upright fronds, often variegated with white, found in warm, sheltered spots.

ferns.name: Cheilanthes lanosa
ferns.description: This fern has fuzzy fronds and is adapted to dry, rocky habitats.

ferns.name: Pellaea rotundifolia
ferns.description: A compact fern with round leaflets, ideal for growing in pots or shaded gardens.

ferns.name: Adiantum pedatum
ferns.description: A graceful fern with horizontally spreading fronds, often found in moist, shaded woodlands.

description: A family of ferns distinguished by their elongated sori and often linear fronds, found in various habitats worldwide.

ferns.name: Asplenium nidus
ferns.description: A tropical fern with large, spoon-shaped fronds, often grown as a houseplant.

ferns.name: Asplenium scolopendrium
ferns.description: A fern with undivided, strap-like fronds that thrive in shaded, limestone-rich areas.

ferns.name: Asplenium trichomanes
ferns.description: A small fern with dark, wiry stems and pinnate fronds, typically found on rocks.

ferns.name: Asplenium bulbiferum
ferns.description: A fern known for producing tiny plantlets on its fronds, often found in moist environments.

ferns.name: Asplenium ruta-muraria
ferns.description: A hardy fern that grows on limestone rocks and walls, with small, divided fronds.

description: A family of ferns characterized by their leathery, often pinnate fronds, commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions.

ferns.name: Blechnum spicant
ferns.description: A fern with stiff, erect fronds, often found in acidic soils in woodlands.

ferns.name: Blechnum chilense
ferns.description: A robust fern with arching, leathery fronds, commonly used in ornamental gardening.

ferns.name: Blechnum occidentale
ferns.description: A fern with spreading fronds that prefers wet, marshy environments.

ferns.name: Blechnum penna-marina
ferns.description: A small, hardy fern with creeping rhizomes, often found in alpine regions.

ferns.name: Blechnum tabulare
ferns.description: A fern with large, pinnate fronds, typically found in mountainous areas.

description: A family of ferns known for their often pinnate and finely divided fronds, common in temperate and tropical regions.

ferns.name: Thelypteris palustris
ferns.description: A fern that thrives in wetlands, with finely divided, pinnate fronds.

ferns.name: Phegopteris hexagonoptera
ferns.description: A fern with broad, triangular fronds, typically found in moist, shaded forests.

ferns.name: Thelypteris noveboracensis
ferns.description: A fern with delicate, tapering fronds, common in eastern North American woodlands.

ferns.name: Thelypteris kunthii
ferns.description: A robust fern with large, pinnate fronds, often found in southern U.S. woodlands.

ferns.name: Thelypteris decursive-pinnata
ferns.description: A fern with finely divided, feathery fronds, commonly found in Japan and East Asia.

description: A family of large, often woody ferns known for their bipinnate fronds and preference for wet habitats.

ferns.name: Osmunda regalis
ferns.description: A tall, elegant fern with bipinnate fronds, often found in wetlands and along streams.

ferns.name: Osmundastrum cinnamomeum
ferns.description: A fern with large, cinnamon-colored fertile fronds and bright green sterile fronds.

ferns.name: Osmunda claytoniana
ferns.description: A fern with large fronds that are 'interrupted' by fertile sporangia in the middle.

ferns.name: Osmunda japonica
ferns.description: A fern with finely divided, bipinnate fronds, common in Japan and East Asia.

ferns.name: Osmunda spectabilis
ferns.description: Similar to the Royal Fern, this species is native to North America and prefers wet habitats.

description: A family of ferns known for their creeping rhizomes and delicate, often hairy fronds, commonly found in tropical regions.

ferns.name: Davallia canariensis
ferns.description: A fern with delicate, feathery fronds and creeping rhizomes, often grown as an ornamental plant.

ferns.name: Davallia fejeensis
ferns.description: Known for its furry rhizomes resembling rabbit feet, this fern is popular as a houseplant.

ferns.name: Davallia mariesii
ferns.description: A small fern with finely divided fronds and creeping rhizomes, often found in rocky areas.

ferns.name: Davallia trichomanoides
ferns.description: A fern with delicate, lace-like fronds and hairy rhizomes, commonly grown in hanging baskets.

ferns.name: Davallia solida
ferns.description: This fern has thick, furry rhizomes and leathery fronds, often found in tropical forests.

description: A family of tree ferns known for their tall, trunk-like stems and large, spreading fronds, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions.

ferns.name: Cyathea cooperi
ferns.description: A fast-growing tree fern with large, arching fronds, commonly found in tropical gardens.

ferns.name: Cyathea medullaris
ferns.description: A tall tree fern with dark, rough trunks and large, feathery fronds, native to New Zealand.

ferns.name: Cyathea dealbata
ferns.description: A fern with silvery undersides on its fronds, an iconic symbol of New Zealand.

ferns.name: Cyathea spinulosa
ferns.description: A tree fern with spiny stems and large, leathery fronds, typically found in Asian forests.

ferns.name: Cyathea smithii
ferns.description: A delicate tree fern with soft, finely divided fronds, often found in moist, shaded areas.

description: A family of ferns with highly divided, often lacy fronds, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions.

ferns.name: Dicranopteris linearis
ferns.description: A fern with forked, sprawling fronds, commonly found in open, disturbed habitats.

ferns.name: Gleichenia microphylla
ferns.description: A fern with finely divided, coral-like fronds, often found in moist, sandy soils.

ferns.name: Sticherus flabellatus
ferns.description: A fern with radiating fronds that resemble an umbrella, typically found in damp, shaded areas.

ferns.name: Gleichenia dicarpa
ferns.description: A fern with small, rounded fronds, commonly found in wetlands and marshes.

ferns.name: Gleichenia alpina
ferns.description: A hardy fern with delicate, finely divided fronds, often found in alpine regions.
